Option A: Worker Bees and Queen Bees Are All Female and Genetically Identical

This statement supports the finding that workers and queens are all females and genetically identical because it states that both types of bees ( Workers/Queen) have the same genetics which means they come from the same parents therefore must be the exact same species. 

It does not specify whether the genetics are 100% identical or just highly similar but since there seems to be little variation between worker bees and queens even though they are physically distinct individuals I assume that the genetics must also be extremely close to being identical.  


Option B: Little Genetic Difference Between Bees and Fruit Flies

This statement contradicts Option A as it suggests that there may be some small genetic differences between worker bees and queen bees and also fruitflies. However these slight variations do not change the fact that all three insects are part of the same family (Hymenoptera), genus (Apis) and species (Apis mellifera). It could be possible that within each insect group there exist some more subtle sub-species but given how closely related the insects are I believe we can safely assume there aren't any significant genetic differences between them. 

Option C: Royal Actin Can Only Be Stored For a Short Time, and It Will Be Broken Down Into Other Substances Over a Long Period of Time

This statement contradicts Options A and B as it implies that although worker bees and queen bees have the same genetics they do not necessarily have the same properties due to small changes in their DNA. Furthermore Option C suggests that "Royalactin" itself breaks down over time which conflicts with Option A who stated that it remains unchanged throughout storage. Therefore Option C cannot possibly be supported by the evidence provided.

Passage: A researcher fed honeybee larvae separately with fresh royal jelly and royal jelly that had been stored for 30 days. The results showed that the larvae fed with fresh royal jelly grew into queens. Further research found that a protein called "royalactin" in fresh royal jelly can promote the secretion of growth hormone, making the larvae have the characteristics of queen bee, such as larger body size and well-developed ovaries. The researchers fed fruit flies with this protein, and the fruit flies also showed an increase in body length, number of eggs and lifespan, indicating that the effect of this protein on biological characteristics is cross-species.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can support the above researchers' findings?
A. A.The worker bees and queen bees in the colony are all female and genetically identical, and their larvae are no different.
B. B.There is little genetic difference between bees and fruit flies, and they share many of the same biological characteristics.
C. C."Royalactin" can only be stored for a short time, and it will be broken down into other substances over a long period of time.
D. D.The food for bee larvae that can grow into queens is royal jelly, while the food for other larvae is only pollen and honey.
Answer:

Read the question and options thoroughly and select the correct answer from the four answer labels. Read the passage thoroughly to ensure you know what the passage entails.

Passage: Ivy usually refers to eight universities in the eastern United States. Ivy has always been synonymous with famous schools in the United States. These eight universities not only have a long history and rigorous scholarship, but also have high teaching quality. Most of the graduates of these schools become social elites, most of whom earn more than $200000 a year. There are many political leaders from the Ivy, and a large number of scientists graduated from the Ivy.Question: According to the above conditions, which of the following options must be true?
A. A.Some social elites earn more than $200000 a year.
B. B.Some political leaders earn less than $200000 a year.
C. C.Some scientists earn more than $200000 a year.
D. D.Some political leaders are social elites.
Answer:

data.sampled: Based on the information provided in the passage, we can infer that Conclusion (C) should be selected as it accurately reflects the main idea of the paragraph. The lack of basic medical knowledge is considered a major factor contributing to the repetition of successes for untrained quacks, who often rely on inaccurate or misleading treatments. It is important for individuals to obtain accurate healthcare advice from reputable sources and to seek professional help when necessary.

Passage: At the end of 2009, the results of a survey conducted by the Ministry of Health of China showed that only 6.48% of the people had overall health quality, of which only 4.66% had the literacy of chronic disease prevention. This shows that the national awareness of the disease is still very poor. Only when the national quality is fundamentally improved, the fallacies of Li Yi and Zhang Wuben will not have so many people blindly follow.Question: Which of the following conclusions can be inferred from the above statement?
A. A.The lack of awareness of the disease is one of the manifestations that the national quality needs to be fundamentally improved.
B. B.If the quality of the national awareness cannot be fundamentally improved, many people will blindly follow the fallacies of Li Yi and others.
C. C.The lack of basic medical knowledge is the root cause of the repeated success of quack doctors.
D. D.Only when the people raise their awareness of the disease can their health be guaranteed.
Answer:

Passage: A research paper published in a famous foreign academic journal reveals that when people are angry, there will be a series of reactions in the body, which will make the heart beat faster and endocrine disorder, and cause high blood pressure and digestive system disorder. In severe cases, it may cause vomiting or even fainting, and it can also cause skin freckles to increase in the future. Zhang San hopes that his child can go to a famous university. If he sees the grades his child are not satisfactory, he will sulk.Question: Based on the conclusion of the question, which of the followings, if true, can best lead to the conclusion that Zhang San is angry?
A. A.Zhang San's blood pressure has increased.
B. B.Zhang San's blood pressure increased and vomited.
C. C.Zhang San's blood pressure increased and vomited. At the same time, Zhang San was accompanied by syncope, and the number of freckles on the skin also increased.
D. D.In the final exam of the semester,the grades of two of the son of the Zhang San subjects dropped.
Answer:

The passage provides evidence supporting the idea that Snakes evolved from a legged animal to a non-footed animal. Additionally, the statement "It turns out that this snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of the origin of snakes." suggests that the true-footed snake shares features common with contemporary lizards, further bolstering this conclusion. Finally, the statement "The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is that it was alienated in the rock, with only four bones in its ankle and no toes," supports the idea that the true-footed snake's feet were less developed than those of today's snakes, providing additional evidence of its evolutionary history. In summary, based on the information provided I believe that **"C"** best supports the view of the scholars mentioned in the passage.

Passage: Using the X-ray technology of the European Synchrotron radiation Accelerator, the researchers scanned a fossil of a true-footed snake hidden in an ancient rock dating back 9500 million years. It turns out that this snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of the origin of snakes. The research report points out that the snake is 50 centimeters long. On the surface, it has only one foot, about 2 centimeters long. The other foot of the real foot snake was found by X-ray scanning. The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is that it was alienated in the rock, with only four bones in its ankle and no toes, indicating that the feet of true-footed snakes had deteriorated at that time.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the views of the above scholars?
A. A.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from non-footed animal to legged lizards.
B. B.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from a legged animal to non-footed animal.
C. C.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes degenerated from non-footed animal to a legged lizard.
D. D.The age of this true-footed snake coincides with the period when snakes degenerated from a legged animal to a non-footed animal.
Answer:

data.sampled: Based on the information provided my best guess for an answer would be **"D**. Different enzymes require different genes to encode." This conclusion is supported by the fact that different enzymes have different functions and requirements, so it makes sense for there to be multiple ways to code for them. Additionally, the study found that not all genes were used equally in encoding proteins, which supports the idea that different genes contribute unique insights into biological processes.

Passage: There are thousands of genes in nature. Which genes are the most common and abundant? After successfully decoding a large number of genomes, a research institute found the answer: transposons, known as "selfish DNA". The abundance and breadth of transposon genes indicate that they play a vital role in evolution and the maintenance of biodiversity.Biology textbooks generally believe that the enzyme that can fix carbon dioxide in photosynthesis is the most abundant enzyme on earth, and some scholars have speculated that the genes that can encode this enzyme should also be the most abundant. But the study found that transposons, known as "junk DNA", instead dominate the known genetic world.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the speculation of the scholar(there is a version of the findings of the study)?
A. A.The basic function of transposons is to spread themselves everywhere.
B. B.The same enzyme is sometimes encoded by different genes.
C. C.Different enzymes may have the same gene to encode.
D. D.Different enzymes require different genes to encode.
Answer:
